instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Green Light no power CPU overheating
threads.message: And another one... this one green light on no power cpu overheating :eek:

threads.message:
Fan spins later on this machine; don't use it as refference for board start.
Post some voltages on the big coils...

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Green Light no power CPU overheating
threads.message:
Hi guys.

First a wanna say THANK YOU ALL for being and incredible support already i posted 2 times this my second and got replies like i didn't expected that fast. About this laptop managed to find the issue it was the <CHIP>U8020</CHIP> replaced it from a board for parts working good :cool:
